page.title: 04FISH FACTORY SEAHOUSES
page.content: Fish processing is carried out in Seahouses at the firm of J.W.Thorburn & Sons established in 1945. The firm, which employs 10, mainly supplies small local shops , but, does have its own retail van. The white fish used come from fishing ports up as far as Fraserburgh on the East Coast. The Herring used to make their kippers come from the West Coast of Scotland, mainly the Loch Fyne area. Kippering is carried out in the traditional way, smoking with hard wood shavings for about 6 hours, and no articial colouring or preservative is used. All transport is by road and the firm uses a refrigerated container when collecting and delivering fish and fish products.
